intro: Isochilostachya, commonly known as the narrow-leaf grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The inflorescence consists of a single spikelet, which is typically terminal and sometimes accompanied by a few lateral ones. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, with three stamens and a single pistil. Isochilostachya species are typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, often growing in sandy or rocky soils.
